article.headline: N. Carolina A&T 73, Florida A&M 70
article.story: TALLAHASSEE, Fla. (AP) -- Michael Hayes' 19 points and Leslie Powell's clench 3-point baskets powered North Carolina A&T over Florida A&M 73-70 Monday. Down 61-59 with just under four and a half minutes to play, Powell hit a 3-pointer to give the Aggies a brief lead. After Jonathan Kelly answered with a 2-foot jumper for Florida A&M (11-14, 7-6), Powell scored another 3-pointer to push the Aggie lead to 65-63 with 3:05 left to play. North Carolina A&T (4-18, 4-8) led for the rest of the game. The Aggies squad had four players in double figures: Powell with 16 points, Jason Wills with 13 points and Trahern Chaplin with 12 points. The Rattlers' Tony Tate had 15 points and Kelly contributed 16. Brian Greene notched a double-double with 11 points and 10 rebounds. Despite 52.2 percent shooting from the field by the Rattlers in the first half, the visiting Aggies took a 38-35 lead into halftime.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
